column4: Hi, im closing my Dedicated server and i need to make a backup of my SQL databse
I havnt used for a long time and have forgotten and lost my commmand stuff
but ive forgot how to do it all in putty
my server gets shut down in less than 2 hours and I need to copy it to my laptop
what would the full command at root be iceroot
just "man mysqldump" to see what order things should go in
fire up mysql, and run statement "show databases;" to get a list of dbs.
that code doesnt include username and password
see what iceroot has posted :) -u username, etc.
the file should have been created in the directory from which you ran mysqldump. probably your home dir?
well, there it should be, then.
it should be in the dir where you executed mysqldump - just "ls -al ." to list contenst.
but yes, you can also find it with "find / -name mysqldump.sql" (or whatever filename you made)
